summary:
The Security Council,
Recalling previous resolutions on Côte d'Ivoire, particularly 1652 (2006) and 1667 (2006), 
Reaffirming commitment to Côte d'Ivoire's sovereignty, independence, territorial integrity, and unity, 
Noting reports of the Secretary-General dated 3 January 2006, 11 April 2006, and his letters to the President of the Security Council, 
Expressing concern at the persistence of the crisis in Côte d'Ivoire, 
Determining the situation in Côte d'Ivoire poses a threat to international peace and security, 
Acting under Chapter VII of the Charter, 
1. Notes the Secretary-General's recommendations, 
2. Authorizes an increase in UNOCI personnel until 15 December 2006, up to 1,500 additional personnel, including 1,025 military and 475 civilian police, 
3. Intends to review UNOCI's personnel levels in light of the situation, 
4. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
